1.text: Then Jonah prayed to Yahweh, his God, out of the fish’s belly.

2.text: He said, “I called because of my affliction to Yahweh. He answered me. Out of the belly of Sheol I cried. You heard my voice.

3.text: For you threw me into the depths, in the heart of the seas. The flood was all around me. All your waves and your billows passed over me.

4.text: I said, ‘I have been banished from your sight; yet I will look again toward your holy temple.’

5.text: The waters surrounded me, even to the soul. The deep was around me. The weeds were wrapped around my head.

6.text: I went down to the bottoms of the mountains. The earth barred me in forever: yet have you brought up my life from the pit, Yahweh my God.

7.text: “When my soul fainted within me, I remembered Yahweh. My prayer came in to you, into your holy temple.

8.text: Those who regard lying vanities forsake their own mercy.

9.text: But I will sacrifice to you with the voice of thanksgiving. I will pay that which I have vowed. Salvation belongs to Yahweh.”

10.text: Yahweh spoke to the fish, and it vomited out Jonah on the dry land.
